definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人攀爬這條峻峭的上坡路有困難。

sentences.english: He ascended the incline, and turned to the right.
Stgot-owned enterprises collect out of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 國有企業下手走上坡路。

sentences.english: Changes of Zhang's mental state of producing and the improving tendency in his way of producing.
sentences.chinese: 張恨水創作心態的變化及他在創作上的上坡路趨勢。

sentences.english: The last part of the ascent is very steep.
There was a steep climb on the road out of town.
sentences.chinese: 市外公路上有一處很陡的上坡路。

sentences.english: No matter which way you have to march, its always uphill.
sentences.chinese: 不管你從哪條路線行軍，都是上坡路。

sentences.english: The ascent was steep and difficult.
sentences.chinese: 這上坡路很陡峭及堅難。

sentences.english: The first part of the ascent is not steep.
sentences.chinese: 開始一段上坡路並不陡峭。

sentences.english: When the road you're trudging seems all uphill.
sentences.chinese: 當你走的路看起來全部是上坡路時。

sentences.english: It was an awkward ascent, but we reached the top eventually.
sentences.chinese: 雖然上坡路難行，但我們最終還是到達了山頂。

definition: uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
